oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Babe Ruth in Knoxville, 1925
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Babe Ruth (George Herman Ruth), New York Yankees, posing with unidentified Masons and Police officers. Edd Grady at far right. Ruth, "Baseball's Most Expensive Player," was in Knoxville to play a game with the New York Yankees vs. the Brooklyn Dodgers at Caswell Park. April 6, 1925. Article describing visit in Knoxville Journal, April 6, 1925.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Baseball players; Group portraits; Police; Fraternal organizations; Uniforms; Events;
